item.title: Rewilders: The Lost Spring ‘Grasslands’ private playtest set for November 12 to 19
item.content:encoded:
• PC

New video showcases gameplay mechanics, story, and characters.

Herobeat Studios has will host a the “Grasslands” private playtest for open-world roguelite action game Rewilders: The Lost Spring from November 12 to 19, the developer announced. Sign-ups are available now via the game’s Steam page.

The developer also released a new video featuring the latest look at gameplay, traversal, and dangers in the open world, plus a few hints at the story and characters.

Get the latest details below.

About

In their latest video, the developers elaborate on the core gameplay of their upcoming open-world roguelite, featuring Metroidvania and creature-collecting elements. Many roguelite, roguelike, and Soulsborne players will be familiar with a home base as the anchor point, where players can rest, engage with rescued creatures, and rework their approach when venturing out into the world. Rewilders: The Lost Spring features a floating airship that presents several facets to play with, from planting seeds that sprout buffs, crafting consumables and weapons, to evolving you and your companions, known as Hantu. Traversal methods, such as the Hookshot and wall run, are available and can be earned through boss fights.

Videos, as lovely as they are, only convey so much when it comes to games. From November 12 to 17, a select number of playtesters will be invited to try Rewilders: The Lost Spring‘s Grasslands Playtest. Sign-ups are open now on Steam, and once approved, playtesters will be able to access future playtests starting with the Grasslands Playtest. More details will be shared on Steam and Discord, so we invite all potential players and playtesters to join as the game develops towards Early Access.

Key Features

  • An open-world roguelite experience where curiosity and discovery go hand in hand, finding items, secrets, and paths to new challenges.
  • Growth and rewards to be gained from fighting back against the corruption of Abi’s home across five unique biomes with their own bosses.
  • Multiple combinations and approaches to play with while engaging in combat, utilizing several kinds of Hântu, abilities, levels, and buffs (permanent or temporary).
  • A heart-warming story about family, friendship, resilience, and kindness.
  • Moving music, scenes from renowned artist Julie Elven, and the makers of Endling: Extinction is Forever.

The Story of Rewilders: The Lost Spring

Players will embody Abi, a survivor returning to the poisoned surface of the world to rescue her lost family and restore the wild. While exploring corrupted biomes—unlocking Hantu, finding lore, secrets, and enemies born from a failed society—she will come across her family and help restore them just as she will her environments, with the help of a mysterious being called Rif. The team was heavily inspired by the works of Hayao Miyazaki and Studio Ghibli films, which convey messages of ecological destruction, empowerment, and family, while developing Rewilders: The Lost Spring. Utilizing creative audio-visual presentations and gameplay to tell evocative stories is a key component of Herobeat’s development philosophy.

Rewilders: The Lost Spring is due out in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2026, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, an dSwitch at a later date.

item.title: My Hero Academia: All’s Justice ‘Game Modes’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Story Mode, Team Up Mission, Archives Battle, and Hero's Diary.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Byking have released a 12-minute trailer for My Hero Academia: All’s Justice introducing the game’s modes.

Modes showcased in the trailer include:

  • Story Mode – You’ll be able to relive the final battle, which is currently airing in the anime, from a unique, game-specific perspective, and with your own actions at the core. Experience the emotional impact of the final battle to its climax, thanks to stunning graphics and impactful presentation.
  • Team Up Mission – In this mode, you will choose a student of Class 1-A at U.A. High School, like Deku, and take on training exercises set within a virtual space based on an original script created with support by the original creator of My Hero Academia. You can also form a team by gathering your Class 1-A classmates and experience what it’s like to be a hero as a Class 1-A student. Use each character’s unique Quirk for actions like moving through the city, or efficiently exploring and battling. In addition to the main missions where you complete assigned training tasks, during Team Up Mission, you can also enjoy side missions that start through conversations with characters scattered around the city. There’s also plenty to do, like collecting hidden cards throughout the city! We hope you will be able to experience a different and special side of My Hero Academia: All’s Justice through battling it out against multiple opponents, traversing the city, or finding collectibles.
  • Archives Battle – Unlocked after clearing Team Mission. In this mode, you can relive iconic battles from the original story, such as Deku, Todoroki, and lida’s fight with Stain, or Endeavor and Hawks’ battle against the High-End Nomu. We are developing this mode to satisfy those who want to re-experience the intense battles that have unfolded in throughout the story. These battles may be more challenging than in other modes and have special gameplay experiences unique to this mode, so we definitely encourage you to give it a try.
  • Hero’s Diary – Unlocked after clearing Team Mission. In this mode, you can watch never-before-seen character moments with each other with voice acting that depict the unknown daily lives of the U.A. High Class 1-A students, along with a bit of exploration, battles, and parkour movements. From training with Deku and Bakugo to practice exercises featuring unexpected combinations like Mineta, Ashido, and Koda, there are various episodes where you might discover new sides to your favorite characters. By experiencing what may be surprising sides to the characters, we hope you will deepen your own relationship with Class 1-A students, the growth fostered by the Hero Academy, and the world of My Hero Academia.

The trailer also offers a deeper dive into the game’s battle system.

My Hero Academia: All’s Justice is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on February 6, 2026.

item.title: 2.5D turn-based roguelike game Eternity Breaker announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

From Banchou Tactics developer Secret Character.

Banchou Tactics developer Secret Character has announced Eternity Breaker, a 2.5D turn-based roguelike game where gained skills determine your class. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Build your class, break the cycle. A 2.5D turn-based roguelike where the skills you gain become your class.

A 2.5D Turn-Based Roguelike Skill Builder

​Eternity Breaker is a Turn-based Roguelike game with 2.5D pixel art fantasy graphics. The story is about the battle to find a way out of an endless dungeon.

In Eternity Breaker, combat requires the use of Skills. In each combat round, the Skills available for use are randomized, and skill upgrade statuses can also be randomized.

Example Skills in the game

Skill types in the game are divided into three main categories:

  • ​Melee (Red)
  • Magic (Blue)
  • Technical (Green)

Each Skill type functions differently.

Furthermore, the Skills you acquire in battle will also affect the main character’s class.

​Classes in this game are divided into 2 types:

  • ​Basic Class – Has additional special techniques.
  • High Class – Has an additional ultimate attack.

For example, if you acquire two Red-type Skills, you will change to the Warrior class. If you then get two Blue-type Skills, you will change to the Battle Mage class.

​Or, if you get four Red-type Skills, you will change to the Black Knight class instead.

​There are more than 20 classes available in the game.

​Additionally, combat also features Artifacts and items that allow you to combine various combat techniques, creating new and diverse playstyles in each run.
